OcclusionRays: Number of occlusion rays per sample
MaxDistance: Maximum distance for occlusion rays to test for intersections; a value of 0 means infinity
SpreadAngle: Maximum spread angle in degrees for occlusion rays; for example, 180 degrees will cover the entire hemisphere whereas 90 degrees will only cover the center of the hemisphere down to 45 degrees from the horizon.
BiasAngle: Angle in degrees from the horizon for occlusion rays for which the contribution is attenuated to reduce faceting artifacts.
